Class FileManipulator

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class FileManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileManipulator is used for all file operations (read/write)

    Victor Kirov

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readAllLines(java.lang.String filename)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Read whole content of a text file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file, which have to be written
        Returns:
        List of String, containing file lines.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file is not found or read error occurs.

      • storeAllLines

        public static void storeAllLines(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines,
                 java.lang.String filename)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        lines - The text lines, which will be the new file content.
        filename - The filename, which will be overwritten.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file is not writable or error occurs during file writing.
